links.title: State of CSS 2020
links.description: Same procedure as last year, Miss Sophie? Same CSS procedure as every year, James.

links.title: Creating websites with prefers-reduced-data
links.description: Listening to your users’ needs is not only a nice to have- but a must. Polypane explains the prefers-reduced-data preference.

links.title: 50 Favorite CSS Libraries, Frameworks and Tools
links.description: The Speckyboy Magazine shares its 50 favourite libraries, frameworks and tools of 2020.

links.title: How to build HTML forms right
links.description: In this series, Austin Guile’s shares best practises for creating correct, accessible and secure HTML forms.

links.title: Use console.log like a pro
links.description: A deep dive by Marko Denic into the `console` feature to debug your code and display information from your code.

links.title: The new changelog.com setup for 2020
links.description: Gerhard Dazu explains why and how the Changelog.com team switched the sites infrastructure to Kubernetes.

links.title: Handling Short And Long Content In CSS
links.description: Handling content of different lengths is not easy. Ahmad Shadeed shares possible methods to deal with short or long contents.

links.title: 2020 Design Tools Survey
links.description: The results of the 2020 Design Tools Survey are in. Inspiration and interesting data for anyone working with UI and UX.

links.title: EStimator
links.description: Enter the URL of your website and find out how much bandwidth you could save by using modern JavaScript.
